pageContext.claim: “As you know, the last eight years they borrowed more than it did in the whole history of our country.”
pageContext.analysis: This is misleading. Under Barack Obama the national debt increased nearly $9 trillion, but regardless of his policies the debt would have risen by $3 trillion because of tax and spending policies that were already in place, according to the Committee for a Responsible Budget. A better measure to understand the size of the debt as a ratio of the gross domestic product, the broadest measure of the economy. In 2016, the United States recorded a government debt equivalent to 106.10 percent of the country's GDP. In 1946, debt-to-GDP ratio reached an all time high of 118.90 percent.
